lexUnit.definition: COD: preceding or done in preparation for something fuller or more important.

sentence.text: The preliminary chat which usually prefaces the interview proper is intended to break the ice and give both sides a chance to size each other up .
Couples who wish to adopt a child are likely to find that conditions of acceptance are strict , and preliminary preparation and training sessions prolonged and stringent .

Iran has begun preliminary work to install thousands of centrifuges at its uranium enrichment facility as a dispute roiled over whether the International Atomic Energy Agency was receiving the access it wants to monitor the site , wire services reported today ( see GSN , Feb. 1 ) .
